ground_truth: Neff sits before the dictaphone. Neff comes through the reception room doors with his hat on and his briefcase under his arm. As he walks towards his office, he runs into Keyes, who is wearing his vest and hat but no coat. Keyes is carrying a file of papers and smoking a cigar. He stops by a majolica jar filled with sand, takes a pencil from his vest, and stands over the jar, extinguishing his cigar carefully so as not to damage it, then puts the half-smoked cigar into his vest pocket with the pencil. They move on and stop at a door lettered in embossed chromium: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. Keyes opens the door and they go in. As Keyes and Neff enter, the door to Norton's private office opens, and Mr. Norton is letting out three legal-looking gentlemen. Norton, who is about forty-five, very well-groomed, and rather pompous in manner, sees Keyes and Neff. Neff puts down his hat and briefcase, and he and Keyes pass the legal-looking men and follow Norton into his office, which is naturally the best in the building; modern but not modernistic, spacious, and very well furnished, including flowers, smoking stands, and easy chairs. Norton has gone behind his desk, and after Keyes comes in, Neff closes the door quietly. Norton disapprovingly looks at Keyes in shirt sleeves and smiles frostily. Keyes and Neff sit down while Norton remains standing and walks up and down behind his desk thinking hard. There is a charged pause as he looks back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictograph on his desk buzzes, and he reaches over to depress a key and puts the earpiece to his ear, then replaces it and turns back to Keyes and Neff. Keyes and Neff start to get up just as the secretary opens the door. Neff stands staring at the door and then relaxes with an obvious effort of will as Phyllis comes in wearing a gray tailored suit, a small black hat with a veil, black gloves, and carrying a black bag. The secretary closes the door behind her. Mr. Norton goes to meet her and turns a little towards Keyes, arranging a chair for Phyllis, who sits and nods silently. Neff stands behind a false mantel, completely deadpan, staring straight at Phyllis, and their eyes meet for a fraction of a second. She makes as if to rise indignantly, turns, and walks out, the door closing after her. There is a pregnant pause, and Keyes stands up, grabs the glass of water out of Norton's hand, and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Neff perches before the dictation machine. Neff arrives through the lobby portals with his hat on and his briefcase beneath his arm. As he strides toward his workspace, he encounters Keyes, who is donned in his vest and hat but no jacket. Keyes is holding a dossier of documents and puffing a cigar. He pauses by a majolica container filled with sand, takes a pencil from his vest, and stands over the container, snuffing his cigar meticulously so as not to mar it, then places the half-smoked cigar into his vest pocket with the pencil. They proceed and halt at a portal inscribed in embossed chromium: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. Keyes opens the portal and they enter. As Keyes and Neff step in, the portal to Norton's private workspace opens, and Mr. Norton is ushering out three legal-appearing gentlemen. Norton, who is about forty-five, very well-groomed, and rather bombastic in demeanor, notices Keyes and Neff. Neff sets down his hat and briefcase, and he and Keyes pass by the legal-appearing gentlemen and trail Norton into his workspace, which is naturally the best in the edifice; contemporary but not ultramodern, roomy, and very well adorned, including flowers, smoking stands, and easy chairs. Norton has proceeded behind his desk, and after Keyes enters, Neff shuts the portal quietly. Norton disapprovingly glances at Keyes in shirt sleeves and smiles icily. Keyes and Neff perch while Norton remains standing and paces back and forth behind his desk contemplating deeply. There is a charged pause as he gazes back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictophone on his desk buzzes, and he reaches over to depress a key and places the earpiece to his ear, then restores it and turns back to Keyes and Neff. Keyes and Neff begin to rise just as the assistant opens the portal. Neff stands gazing at the portal and then relaxes with an evident exertion of will as Phyllis enters wearing a gray custom-fitted suit, a petite black hat with a veil, black gloves, and carrying a black satchel. The assistant shuts the portal behind her. Mr. Norton proceeds to greet her and pivots slightly towards Keyes, arranging a chair for Phyllis, who sits and nods silently. Neff stands behind a false mantelpiece, utterly expressionless, staring directly at Phyllis, and their gazes meet for a fraction of a second. She gestures as if to rise angrily, turns, and departs, the portal shutting after her. There is a significant pause, and Keyes rises, seizes the tumbler of water out of Norton's grip, and drains it in one large swallow while Norton observes him nearly bewildered.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Neff is seated before the dictaphone. The reception room doors are entered by Neff with his hat on and his briefcase under his arm. As his walk towards his office occurs, Keyes is run into by him, who wears his vest and hat but no coat. A file of papers is carried by Keyes, who smokes a cigar. He is stopped by a majolica jar filled with sand, a pencil is taken from his vest by him, and he stands over the jar, carefully extinguishing his cigar so it is not damaged, then the half-smoked cigar is put into his vest pocket with the pencil. They proceed and stop at a door lettered in embossed chromium: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. The door is opened by Keyes and they go in. As Keyes and Neff enter, the door to Norton's private office is opened, and Mr. Norton lets out three legal-looking gentlemen. Norton, who is about forty-five, very well-groomed, and rather pompous in manner, sees Keyes and Neff. Neff's hat and briefcase are put down by him, and the legal-looking men are passed by him and Keyes as they follow Norton into his office, which is naturally the best in the building; modern but not modernistic, spacious, and very well furnished, including flowers, smoking stands, and easy chairs. Norton has gone behind his desk, and after Keyes comes in, the door is closed by Neff quietly. Norton disapprovingly looks at Keyes in shirt sleeves and smiles frostily. Keyes and Neff sit down while Norton remains standing and walks up and down behind his desk thinking hard. There is a charged pause as he looks back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictograph on his desk buzzes, and a key is depressed by him to reach over and put the earpiece to his ear, then it is replaced and he turns back to Keyes and Neff. Keyes and Neff start to get up just as the door is opened by the secretary. The door is stared at by Neff, and then he relaxes with an obvious effort of will as Phyllis comes in wearing a gray tailored suit, a small black hat with a veil, black gloves, and carrying a black bag. The door is closed by the secretary behind her. Mr. Norton goes to meet her and turns a little towards Keyes, arranging a chair for Phyllis, who sits and nods silently. Neff stands behind a false mantel, completely deadpan, staring straight at Phyllis, and for a fraction of a second, their eyes meet. She acts as if to rise indignantly, turns, and walks out, the door closing after her. There is a pregnant pause, and Keyes stands up, grabs the glass of water, and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Neff sits at the dictaphone. He enters the reception room with his hat on and briefcase under his arm, encountering Keyes, who wears a vest and hat but no coat, carrying papers and a cigar. Keyes stops by a majolica jar, extinguishes his cigar carefully with a pencil, and pockets both. They proceed to a door marked: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. Inside, Norton, a well-groomed, pompous man of forty-five, dismisses three legal-looking men as Keyes and Neff enter his modern, spacious office, furnished with flowers and easy chairs. Norton stands behind his desk, disapprovingly observing Keyes in shirt sleeves while pacing thoughtfully. A dictograph buzz interrupts him; he listens momentarily before addressing Keyes and Neff, who start to rise as a secretary opens the door for Phyllis, elegantly dressed in a gray suit and black accessories. Norton arranges a chair for her. Neff, expressionless, locks eyes with Phyllis briefly before she exits indignantly. A tense pause follows before Keyes grabs a glass of water from Norton and drains it as Norton watches, stunned.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Neff sits before the dictaphone. Neff enters with his hat and briefcase, encounters Keyes in a vest, hat, and smoking a cigar. Keyes extinguishes his cigar in a sand-filled jar and pockets it with a pencil. They proceed to a door labeled EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT, and enter. Norton, well-groomed and pompous, is letting out three legal gentlemen. Neff and Keyes follow Norton into his well-furnished office. Norton disapproves of Keyes's attire and smiles frostily. Keyes and Neff sit while Norton paces behind his desk. The dictograph buzzes; Norton listens briefly and turns back to them. As they rise, the secretary opens the door for Phyllis, dressed in a gray suit with a black hat, gloves, and bag. Norton arranges a chair for her, and Phyllis nods silently. Neff, deadpan, stares at Phyllis. She pretends to rise indignantly, exits, and Keyes drains Norton's water glass as Norton watches, stupefied.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Neff sits composedly before the dictaphone, preparing for what seems like an important task. Soon after, Neff emerges into the reception room, moving through the doors with noticeable purpose, his hat perched neatly on his head and a briefcase snugly tucked under his arm. As Neff strides purposefully towards his office within the bustling building, he encounters Keyes. Keyes, dressed only in his vest and hat, noticeably lacks a coat. He is holding a sizable file of papers and nonchalantly smoking a cigar. Stopping momentarily by a sturdy majolica jar filled with sand, Keyes methodically retrieves a pencil from his vest pocket. He stands over the jar with deliberate care, gently extinguishing his cigar, ensuring not to cause any damage, then meticulously places the half-smoked cigar back into his vest pocket alongside the pencil. 

Together, Keyes and Neff proceed onward, pausing at a door prominently marked with embossed chromium letters that read: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. Keyes confidently opens the door and both he and Neff step inside. As they make their entrance, the door leading to Norton's private office swings open, and they observe Mr. Norton ushering out three distinguished legal-looking gentlemen. Mr. Norton, who appears to be around forty-five years old, is impeccably groomed and exudes a rather self-important air. He notices Keyes and Neff entering. Neff carefully sets down his hat and briefcase as both he and Keyes pass by the departing gentlemen, following Norton into his office. This impressive office is, as expected, the finest in the building; it boasts a modern yet not overly modernistic design, offering spaciousness and tasteful furnishings, including fresh flowers, smoking stands, and comfortable easy chairs. 

Norton positions himself behind his desk, and after Keyes enters, Neff quietly closes the door behind him. Norton casts a disapproving glance at Keyes, who is dressed in nothing more than shirt sleeves, and offers a frosty smile. Both Keyes and Neff settle into their seats while Norton remains standing, pacing thoughtfully behind his desk, deep in contemplation. An electrified pause ensues as he scans back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictograph on his desk suddenly buzzes, prompting him to reach over, press a key, and place the earpiece against his ear, before settling it back onto the desk and turning his attention once more to Keyes and Neff. 

As Keyes and Neff begin to rise, the secretary opens the door. Neff stands momentarily, staring intently at the door, then visibly relaxes with a determined effort as Phyllis enters, dressed in a sophisticated gray tailored suit, donning a small black hat with a delicate veil, black gloves, and carrying an elegant black bag. The secretary politely closes the door behind her. Mr. Norton steps forward to greet her, slightly turning towards Keyes while arranging a chair for Phyllis, who sits gracefully and offers a silent nod. Neff remains standing behind a false mantel, his expression inscrutable, eyes fixed intently on Phyllis as their glances meet fleetingly. She appears ready to rise indignantly, but instead, she turns and gracefully exits, the door closing gently behind her. A weighted silence follows, and Keyes suddenly stands up, seizes the glass of water from Norton's hand, and drinks it all in one swift motion while Norton looks on, seemingly bewildered by Keyes' bold action.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Neff is seated with a calm demeanor in front of the dictaphone, preparing himself for what seems like an important task ahead. Shortly thereafter, Neff steps into the bustling reception room, making his way through the doors with a sense of purpose that is hard to miss, his hat carefully perched on his head and a briefcase securely held under his arm. As Neff strides with determination towards his office within the dynamic and busy building, he encounters fellow colleague, Keyes. Keyes, notably without a coat, is clad only in his vest and hat. He holds a substantial file filled with papers in one hand while casually enjoying a cigar in the other. Pausing momentarily beside a robust majolica jar filled with sand, Keyes methodically extracts a pencil from his vest pocket. With deliberate care, he stands over the jar, gently extinguishing his cigar to avoid any possible damage, then meticulously returns the half-smoked cigar to his vest pocket alongside the pencil.

Together, Keyes and Neff move forward, eventually coming to a stop at a door prominently marked with embossed chromium letters stating: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. With a confident motion, Keyes opens the door, allowing both himself and Neff to step inside. As they enter the room, the door leading to Norton's private office swings open, and they witness Mr. Norton escorting out three distinguished gentlemen who have the appearance of legal professionals. Mr. Norton, who seems to be around the age of forty-five, is impeccably groomed and carries himself with an air of self-importance. Upon noticing Keyes and Neff entering the room, Neff takes care to set down his hat and briefcase as they pass by the departing gentlemen, following Norton's lead into his office. This grand office, as expected, stands as the finest in the building; it boasts a modern design that is not excessively modernistic, offering an inviting spaciousness with tasteful furnishings that include fresh flowers, smoking stands, and comfortable easy chairs for visitors.

Norton takes his position behind his desk, and after Keyes enters, Neff quietly closes the door behind him to ensure privacy. Norton casts a disapproving glance at Keyes, who is dressed in no more than shirt sleeves, and offers a frosty smile. Both Keyes and Neff take their seats while Norton remains standing, pacing thoughtfully behind his desk, deep in contemplation. An electrified pause fills the room as Norton scans back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictograph on his desk suddenly comes to life with a buzz, prompting Norton to reach over, press a key, and place the earpiece against his ear, before settling it back onto the desk, redirecting his focus once more to Keyes and Neff.

As Keyes and Neff begin to rise from their seats, the secretary opens the door. Neff pauses momentarily, focusing his gaze intently on the door, then visibly relaxes with an effort of will as Phyllis steps inside, elegantly dressed in a sophisticated gray tailored suit. She is adorned with a small black hat complete with a delicate veil, black gloves, and carries an elegant black bag. The secretary courteously closes the door behind her. Mr. Norton steps forward to greet her, slightly pivoting towards Keyes while arranging a chair for Phyllis, who takes her seat with grace and offers a silent nod. Neff remains standing behind a false mantel, his expression inscrutable, his eyes fixed intently on Phyllis as their glances momentarily meet. She appears poised to rise indignantly, yet instead, she turns and exits gracefully, the door closing gently behind her. A weighted silence envelops the room, and Keyes suddenly rises, seizes the glass of water from Norton's hand, and drinks it all in one quick motion, leaving Norton looking on, seemingly bewildered by Keyes' bold and unexpected action.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Neff positions himself before the dictaphone, preparing to engage with the device. Dressed in his usual attire, he pushes through the reception room doors, his hat perched on his head and his briefcase securely tucked under his arm. As he strides purposefully toward his office, he encounters Keyes, who is notably attired in just his vest and hat, having foregone a coat. Keyes, with a file of papers firmly in hand and a cigar nestled between his lips, pauses momentarily by a majolica jar intricately filled with sand. With practiced precision, he extracts a pencil from his vest pocket and leans over the jar, methodically extinguishing his cigar, ensuring it remains intact before returning the half-smoked cigar into his vest pocket alongside the pencil. Together, they proceed down the corridor and come to a halt in front of a door prominently labeled in embossed chromium letters: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT. Keyes reaches for the door handle, opens it, and they both step inside. As Keyes and Neff make their entrance, the door to Norton's private office swings open, unveiling Mr. Norton as he ushers out three men who have the distinct appearance of legal professionals. Norton, who appears about forty-five, impeccably groomed and exuding a certain pompous demeanor, takes note of Keyes and Neff. Without delay, Neff sets down his hat and briefcase, deftly navigating past the legal-looking gentlemen to join Norton, who leads them into his office, which stands as the finest in the building. This space is modern yet not excessively so, generously proportioned, and tastefully adorned with flowers, smoking stands, and plush easy chairs. Norton, now situated behind his desk, observes as Keyes follows suit, prompting Neff to quietly shut the door behind them. Norton casts a disapproving eye over Keyes in his shirt sleeves, offering a frosty smile. Keyes and Neff settle into their seats while Norton remains on his feet, pacing steadily behind his desk, deep in thought. A charged silence fills the room as Norton casts his gaze between Keyes and Neff. Suddenly, the dictograph on his desk emits a buzz, prompting Norton to reach out and press a key, lifting the earpiece to his ear momentarily before setting it down and turning his attention back to Keyes and Neff. Just as Keyes and Neff begin to rise, the door opens to admit the secretary. Neff stands transfixed, his eyes glued to the doorway, before consciously relaxing as Phyllis makes her entrance, attired in a gray tailored suit, a small black hat with a veil, complemented by black gloves and a black bag. The secretary discreetly closes the door behind her. Mr. Norton steps forward to greet her, subtly shifting towards Keyes as he arranges a chair for Phyllis, who takes her seat with a silent nod. Throughout this, Neff remains immobile behind a false mantel, maintaining a deadpan expression as he locks eyes with Phyllis for a fleeting moment. She appears ready to rise in indignation, pivots, and exits, the door softly closing in her wake. A pregnant pause ensues before Keyes suddenly stands, snatching the glass of water from Norton's hand and downing it in a single, decisive gulp while Norton watches, momentarily stupefied by the action.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Neff sits before the dictaphone after arriving with his hat and briefcase. As he heads to his office, he encounters Keyes, who is carrying a file and smoking a cigar. Keyes stops to extinguish his cigar in a majolica jar and places it in his vest pocket along with a pencil. They proceed to the office of Edward S. Norton, Jr., entering together as Norton dismisses three legal-looking gentlemen. Neff sets down his belongings, and he and Keyes follow Norton into his well-furnished office. After closing the door, Neff observes Norton's frosty smile at Keyes' casual attire. Keyes and Neff sit while Norton paces and thinks. The dictograph on Norton's desk buzzes, prompting him to listen briefly before addressing Keyes and Neff again. As they stand to leave, the secretary opens the door to reveal Phyllis, who enters dressed in a gray suit and black accessories. Norton arranges a chair for her, and she sits, nodding silently. Neff stands expressionless behind a mantel, momentarily locking eyes with her before she exits indignantly. Following a tense silence, Keyes abruptly takes and drinks Norton's glass of water, leaving Norton bewildered.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Neff sits before the dictaphone, a device commonly used in offices during the early to mid-20th century to record spoken notes for later transcription. Neff comes through the reception room doors with his hat on and his briefcase under his arm, a typical businessman's accessory for carrying important documents. As he walks towards his office, he runs into Keyes, who is wearing his vest and hat but no coat, reflecting the fashion norms of the time for professional men. Keyes is carrying a file of papers and smoking a cigar, a symbol of status and leisure in that era. He stops by a majolica jar filled with sand, which acts as an ashtray, takes a pencil from his vest, and stands over the jar, extinguishing his cigar carefully so as not to damage it, then puts the half-smoked cigar into his vest pocket with the pencil. They move on and stop at a door lettered in embossed chromium: EDWARD S. NORTON, JR., PRESIDENT, showcasing the importance of the office occupant. Keyes opens the door and they go in. As Keyes and Neff enter, the door to Norton's private office opens, and Mr. Norton is letting out three legal-looking gentlemen who likely serve as his advisors or partners in matters requiring legal insight. Norton, who is about forty-five, very well-groomed, and rather pompous in manner, sees Keyes and Neff. Neff puts down his hat and briefcase, and he and Keyes pass the legal-looking men and follow Norton into his office, which is naturally the best in the building; modern but not modernistic, spacious, and very well furnished, including flowers, smoking stands, and easy chairs, a reflection of his authoritative position and taste. Norton has gone behind his desk, and after Keyes comes in, Neff closes the door quietly. Norton disapprovingly looks at Keyes in shirt sleeves and smiles frostily, perhaps indicating his disdain for any breach in professional decorum. Keyes and Neff sit down while Norton remains standing and walks up and down behind his desk thinking hard. There is a charged pause as he looks back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictograph on his desk buzzes, a common office communication tool of the period, and he reaches over to depress a key and puts the earpiece to his ear, then replaces it and turns back to Keyes and Neff. Keyes and Neff start to get up just as the secretary opens the door. Neff stands staring at the door and then relaxes with an obvious effort of will as Phyllis comes in wearing a gray tailored suit, a small black hat with a veil, black gloves, and carrying a black bag, indicative of the stylish yet formal attire worn by women visiting an office in the 1940s. The secretary closes the door behind her. Mr. Norton goes to meet her and turns a little towards Keyes, arranging a chair for Phyllis, who sits and nods silently. Neff stands behind a false mantel, completely deadpan, staring straight at Phyllis, and their eyes meet for a fraction of a second, hinting at a shared secret or unspoken tension. She makes as if to rise indignantly, turns, and walks out, the door closing after her. There is a pregnant pause, and Keyes stands up, grabs the glass of water out of Norton's hand, and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied, surprised by the abruptness of the action.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. There is a pregnant pause and Keyes stands up grabs the glass of water out of Norton's hand and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied.

Norton has gone behind his desk and after Keyes comes in Neff closes the door quietly. Norton disapprovingly looks at Keyes in shirt sleeves and smiles frostily. Keyes and Neff sit down while Norton remains standing and walks up and down behind his desk thinking hard. There is a charged pause as he looks back and forth between Keyes and Neff. The dictograph on his desk buzzes and he reaches over to depress a key and puts the earpiece to his ear then replaces it and turns back to Keyes and Neff. Keyes and Neff start to get up just as the secretary opens the door. Neff stands staring at the door and then relaxes with an obvious effort of will as Phyllis comes in wearing a gray tailored suit a small black hat with a veil black gloves and carrying a black bag. The secretary closes the door behind her. Mr Norton goes to meet her and turns a little towards Keyes arranging a chair for Phyllis who sits and nods silently. Neff stands behind a false mantel completely deadpan staring straight at Phyllis and their eyes meet for a fraction of a second. She makes as if to rise indignantly turns and walks out the door closing after her. There is a pregnant pause and Keyes stands up grabs the glass of water out of Norton's hand and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Neff sits before the dictaphone. Neff comes through the reception room doors with his hat on and his briefcase under his arm. As he walks towards his office he runs into Keyes who is wearing his vest and hat but no coat. Keyes is carrying a file of papers and smoking a cigar. He stops by a majolica jar filled with sand takes a pencil from his vest and stands over the jar extinguishing his cigar carefully so as not to damage it then puts the halfsmoked cigar into his vest pocket with the pencil. They move on and stop at a door lettered in embossed chromium. Neff stands staring at the door and then relaxes with an obvious effort of will as Phyllis comes in wearing a gray tailored suit a small black hat with a veil black gloves and carrying a black bag. The secretary closes the door behind her. Mr Norton goes to meet her and turns a little towards Keyes arranging a chair for Phyllis who sits and nods silently. Neff stands behind a false mantel completely deadpan staring straight at Phyllis and their eyes meet for a fraction of a second. She makes as if to rise indignantly turns and walks out the door closing after her. There is a pregnant pause and Keyes stands up grabs the glass of water out of Norton's hand and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied.

Neff stands behind a false mantel completely deadpan staring straight at Phyllis and their eyes meet for a fraction of a second. She makes as if to rise indignantly turns and walks out the door closing after her. There is a pregnant pause and Keyes stands up grabs the glass of water out of Norton's hand and drains it in one big gulp while Norton watches him almost stupefied.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Griffin lounges beside the gramophone. Griffin glides past the courtyard archway with his scarf fluttering and his backpack dangling from his fingers. As he saunters toward his cubicle, he bumps into Harper, who is sporting his overalls and scarf but no boots. Harper is clutching a stack of magazines and chewing on a breadstick. He pauses by a porcelain pitcher brimming with pebbles, extracts a crayon from his overalls, and hovers over the pitcher, snapping his breadstick carefully so as not to spill, then slips the half-snapped breadstick into his overalls pocket with the crayon. They shuffle onward and halt at a portal etched in embossed platinum: MARGARET Q. HARPERSON, SR., TREASURER. Harper swings open the portal and they stride in. As Harper and Griffin enter, the entrance to Harperson's private chamber swings wide, and Ms. Harperson is ushering out three doctor-like people. Harperson, who is about thirty-five, exceptionally polished, and somewhat overbearing in demeanor, acknowledges Harper and Griffin. Griffin drops his scarf and backpack, and he and Harper breeze past the doctor-like figures and trail Harperson into her chamber, which is predictably the finest in the complex; contemporary yet not avant-garde, grand, and exquisitely adorned, featuring statuettes, magazine racks, and recliner sofas. Harperson has drifted behind her console, and after Harper steps through, Griffin gently shuts the entrance. Harperson disdainfully peers at Harper in casual attire and grins icily. Harper and Griffin settle into chairs while Harperson stays upright and meanders behind her console pondering intensely. There is a tense silence as she gazes back and forth between Harper and Griffin. The intercom on her console rings, and she leans over to press a switch and puts the receiver to her ear, then returns it and redirects her attention to Harper and Griffin. Harper and Griffin begin to rise just as the assistant swings open the entrance. Griffin stands scrutinizing the entrance and then unwinds with a visible effort of resolve as Clarissa enters clad in a cerulean embroidered gown, a petite ruby beret with a netted veil, crimson mittens, and clutching a crimson tote. The assistant swings the entrance closed behind her. Ms. Harperson advances to greet her and pivots slightly towards Harper, setting up a couch for Clarissa, who perches and nods mutely. Griffin stands opposite a faux column, utterly impassive, gazing directly at Clarissa, and their eyes lock momentarily. She acts as if to leap indignantly, pivots, and strides out, the entrance swinging shut behind her. There is an expectant lull, and Harper rises, snatches the tumbler of lemonade out of Harperson's grasp, and quaffs it in one substantial swig while Harperson observes him almost flabbergasted.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Neff sits before the dictaphone and enters his office, meeting Keyes, who is wearing his vest and hat. Keyes extinguishes his cigar, and they proceed to Edward S. Norton, Jr.'s office, who is releasing three legal-looking men. Neff and Keyes follow Norton, who remains standing and thinking hard as he disapprovingly looks at Keyes in shirt sleeves. After a pause, the secretary introduces Phyllis, who enters in a gray suit and black accessories. Neff maintains a deadpan stare as their eyes meet briefly. Phyllis makes as if to leave indignantly, exiting the room. Keyes stands up and swiftly drinks Norton's water, leaving Norton astonished.
